title: Men who wanted a son and ended up having a daughter, how did you feel the moment you found out the baby was a girl?
So I just found out we're having another daughter...
body:
So I just found out we're having another daughter, and I'm having trouble grappling with the emotions I'm experiencing.  

I won't lie, I really wanted a son.  I just feel that, as a parent, I'd have a lot to offer a son.  Now don't get me wrong, I totally love my first daughter already, and I wouldn't trade her for anything.  I have no doubt I'm going to be head over heels in love with my next daughter, but the news is still fresh, and I was just wondering if any other dudes have struggled with the emotions you face when you learn you're not having a son.  There's a +90% chance this child is the last we plan to have, and even if we tried for a third, I'd be pretty terrified of having three daughters.  

Thanks for reading - any thought or insight with this would be much appreciated!

title: Guys, would you be put off by a girl who gets scared at night sometimes?
body:
So basically, I'm sort of a huge scaredy cat at night-- and I'm really embarrassed by it. I get scared by loud, wall-shaking thunder, I get scared of the dark, I get scared by nightmares, I get scared from being home alone. I'm not a shut-in or anything, I just get an overactive imagination at night and once those thoughts start creeping in, I get creeped the hell out and I just get (again) too scared to sleep.

This is a really childish problem to have, and I've always been worried that a future SO might get annoyed by it after a while. I can deal with it on my own, but, "dealing with it," usually means staying up until the sun comes out so I can go to sleep. Talking it out pretty much soothes me instantly, but if I'm going to get reduced to little girl status for it, I'd rather not. 

What do you guys think? Thanks in advance for your answers!

title: What does a one-sided relationship look like when you (a man) are the one putting in a lot of work and not seeing it in return?
body: For so long, the traditional role of a man in a relationship was to be a provider and to not have significant emotional needs. Due to this mentality digging its way into our modern society in interesting ways, I feel like many men (myself included) have become so lost in a service mentality that we don't know how to recognize when we are the ones being underappreciated and not attended to by our significant others. I think it would be useful for us to describe scenarios where we felt we were putting in all of the work in a relationship to help other men understand their own emotional needs.

title: Is it unfair to others when I refuse to help them with my personal notes?
body:
It's exam season, and as usual, my phone's being blown up by classmates asking me for my personal notes.

Context: I've been maintaining a Google Drive folder with any and all resources that I can find, ever since the first week of University. I've shared them with people regardless of who they are. But instead of studying from those, I keep getting asked for my personal notes.

People refuse to put in any effort and to make their own personal notes in classes. And like clockwork, my phone gets flooded with messages asking me for my notes, once the exams are close by.

This semester, I've actively refused helping out people, and I'm getting to hear about a lot of negative stuff being talked about me. It sucks, but I feel like I have to keep my foot down, for once.

title: Men who have been emotionally and/or physically abusive in the past: Have you changed? How? Why?
body:
Despite my username, I'm a woman. 

I just broke up with my boyfriend who was emotionally abusive and began showing signs of physical abuse. He threw things and grabbed me once, and would not let go of me. The thing that scared me the most though was he refused to accept his actions were inappropriate. 

After I broke up with him, I also spoke to his ex girlfriend, who told me that he pushed her once. I found out later that she also would hit him, and the time he pushed her, it was because she struck him. I, on the other hand, had not even spoken a word when he grabbed me (he was yelling, I tried to leave the room, he did not want me to.)
Since I broke up with him, he has changed his opinions and acknowledged he was controlling and abusive. He has been going to anger management, as well as seeing a psychiatrist. He also wants to enroll in a men's group therapy, focusing on anger and relationship issues. 

He is supposed to be completely moved out of my apartment today, and after that, I told him I don't want to speak to him. 

What I'm wondering is if any of you have behaved this way before and wanted to change?

I'm not thinking about getting back together with him at this point, but I am concerned for other people he might be interested in.

title: Who has a fear of spiders and does it make you less manly or shameful?
body:
As a guy, I am not ashamed to be scared of these motherfuckers. I do feel less manly sometimes as spiders are the only thing in the world that make me scream like a little girl if one sneaks up on me.

Honestly, it’s the way they move. Their unpredictable little creepy slow walks or the fast ones that really freak me out poisonous or not, same level of fear for me.

Not so scared of big ones like tarantulas, it’s the regular medium to large sized ones with long thin legs and fat bodies that do the damage to my sanity. Or when you spot one on the ceiling in the corner of the room and wonder, how long has that thing been looking at me or devising whatever plan it has for me. Was it going to wait until I fall asleep and crawl in my mouth, lay eggs in my ear?

Worst one ever was waking up one crawling up my arm and almost shit the bed with my reaction.

I don't even have a speciality area of marketing I would want to go into because almost all marketing sounds good unless it is in marketing research. I always thought I could get a marketing job with a pro sports team but I know you have to start out small

title: How do you deal with condescending people?
body:
I had my 4th driving class and I've been out on the road and driving a decent amount.

When I was driving, for the entire hour he talked to me like I was a little kid who's never even seen a fucking road before. I tried not to let it get to me, but he even admitted he was treating me like a baby, and then *proceeded to continue to condescend to me*.

I barely said anything to him.

Halfway through I fucking lost it and stepped on the gas to 60 on a 40 (There was nobody in front of me), and I braked *hard* on every light, just to piss him off.

If I could have walked out, I would have halfway through.

**Edit**: I should clarify his attitude more.

At some point, he just started raising his voice to say, "*YOU* are the DRIVER. *I* am the INSTRUCTOR. You listen to ME." Even though I didn't fucking say anything, I only had just eyed the next lane to make a lane change that he didn't instruct.

title: How do you know when it's time to break it off?
body: I've been dating this girl for about a month and a half now, and she's great, but I don't really feel anything crazy. I often find myself feeling trapped, and I feel really drained after I hang out with her. I don't like it when she sleeps over because I can't really sleep well, but on the other hand, I have fun with her when I hang out. I think what this is pointing towards is just being friends. I often find myself thinking I was happier before I started dating her, and that I had much more freedom to just go after my own goals and live my life on my own. I have a gut feeling that she's just not it. Has anyone experienced this before. I have felt like this for a while but kept telling myself to keep going and see if anything changes, but nothing is really changing.

title: How to convey that it's OK for men to be sensitive?
body:
I often see or hear hurtful comments directed at men. I used to say things about them, to the effect of "generalizing about all men is hurtful", to which I would get a response along the lines of "obviously not all men, but enough, don't police my language, etc".

Personally though, I'm a very sensitive guy. You could call it feminine (though I think that's even unfair, implying that it's not natural for a man to be sensitive or offended). When I hear or read stuff like that I feel lesser and like I should be ashamed for an inherent part of myself. This isn't meant as bashing or anti-feminist or anything like that. I just don't know how to properly convey like "when you say bad things about men, you're also talking about me, and I might not be perfect but I try my hardest and I wish the world didn't have to be so hard at times"

title: What event impacted your life?
body:
Mine was when I was around 14 and my grandfather was dying. My grandfather refused and fought death until my dad told him he will care for his wife, my dad’s mother in law, and he will follow her where she went. My grandfather within ten minutes upon hearing that, died with a calm face. My grandfather feared that no one would take care of her not even their own children until my dad promised him he would. I developed a new respect for my father and help him with my grandmother as much as I can 12 years later. Love you Father.

Edit: I did not expect this post to grow and become this hot. Honestly I have tried to read all the comments but a lot of them made me yell and cry.(yes grown men cry)  i want to tell everyone that I’m always here for you all if you need someone to talk to. Men should support one another.

I'm doing better now. I still miss her and am open to trying again if it happens, but I pretty much realized over the year that we're going to be different people at some point if it happens and those people may or may not be compatible. It fucking sucked to realize that but whatever happens, happens. At least I'm getting my life together after all this.

title: How do you feel about women who live with their parents?
body:
Long time lurker, first time poster...

I've seen plenty of threads in askwomen about whether or not a man living with their parents is a dealbreaker, but I haven't seen anything about women living at home. 

I (27F) have my reasons for moving back home 6 months ago, multiple knee surgeries, I just graduated from college, shitty living situation that I was in previously and I work at our family business. Admittedly, times are tough at work, I've taken a pay cut to help the business stay afloat and can't afford to live on my own right now. I've been dating quite a bit lately and I always wonder if the men I'm meeting consider this a deal breaker or a negative. I know that women my age generally look down on men that live at home (I don't personally, given my own situation), but I want to know what you guys think. 

Do you look down on a woman if she lives with her parents?

I’m a lil ugly i guess but i feel like the main reason is i just haven’t found anything remotely mutual yet…. i also lack some confidence because i’m not sure if anybody has even found me slightly attractive. 

I feel like I’m a really loving dude regardless of whether im single or not but sometimes it can be pretty hard feeling forgotten and alone my whole life… idk maybe it’s all luck?

title: How were you before and after your first relationship?
body:
My opinion,

It's almost been a year since I broke up with my first girlfriend. I feel that the first "puppy love" you feel, the "I'll do anything for you" person inside you, dies after that. Even if the reason for the breakup was not something negative, it'll still break you apart and make you redefine the definition of "love" you have in your mind. Your perspective in general, of how people behave and the philosophy of "do good and get good in return" vanishes, cause now you come out of the bubble and feel like all the things you were taught as a kid were wrong. You might feel vengeful sometimes, you might turn into a casual dating person after that, but you'll still miss that one person sometimes, and that pain will remain there forever.

title: How confident would you be going on a date with a taller women?
body: I’m a short guy, 5’6. The other day I was thinking about how embarrassed I might be on a date with a taller women. Whenever I’m around them I don’t really talk much because I assume they’re uninterested, and I’m not saying I want or need to be the dominant one but I would feel that they’re more dominant. I know this sounds silly.

title: Where do some of y’all get your confidence?
body:
I like dating, anthropologically and socially it’s interesting. I will often know within the first few minutes of a date that I have zero interest in seeing them afterward.

Sometimes, (like when they’re being obnoxiously suggestive) the conversation gets around to me telling them so before dinner is over.

I can tell you that these men are FULLY not listening to a goddamned word I am saying. I will be like, “yeah that’s why this wouldn’t work. I could never be with someone who thought _____,” or “yep, we’ll split the cheque. It’s been neat getting to know you but I’m not interested,” or even “ well Jesus, that’s pretty sexist / racist / homophobic of you”….

… and this man will STILL believe that he is in with a chance …. simply because I am still talking to him. Like I don’t have a genuine perspective, opinions, integrity, or half a brain. I will legitimately be like “you honest to Christ believe I might still go home with you, don’t you?” And he’ll smirk and shoot back a line, and STILL act surprised and offended when I say bye at the end.

Like a human man and a human woman cannot hold a conversation unless it is a prelude to sex.

For some of them, I am pretty sure I’d have to literally leave halfway through dinner or throw a drink in their face for them to accept that I am simply not interested in what they’re bringing to the table.

Sometimes I say “What would it legitimately take for me to convince you that I’m absolutely not interested?” Like, they’ll shoot back a like but I’ll be like, “no I’m being serious. I’ve tried everything short of outright causing a scene in the middle of this restaurant. I am GENUINELY asking you… what would I have to do for you to an actually accept and believe that I don’t want to be with you?”

So like… as someone who struggles with your run-of-the-mill insecurities, like I know all of you do too…. what is with this? Those of you with guy friends who act like this… are they like this all the time? Or just with women?  If you do this, is it just because you’re completely unsure how to deal with being politely shut down, and that’s just how you play it? Like I get feeling uncomfy, but my reaction would be embarrassment and shutting down, not laughing and telling you I think you want me anyway. 

 I feel like if I had half their confidence I’d be goddamn unstoppable.

title: How do you go out alone? What do you do?
body:
I live in a somewhat remote area in europe. There's not much to do around here besides go to bars or clubs at night. Even though i talk to a lot of people when i invite them to hang out or see if i can hang out with them they either tell me theyre staying in or they already have plans.

I stayed in yesterday and really want to go out tonight but im not sure what to do. I made plans with a guy to go check out a new club but now he said he's just gonna go to a club with some other people. I dont want to go to a bar because i wont be able to drink. idk if i want to go to a club because once again i like to drink a little and get loose and thatll be kinda hard to do alone. Also a guy i work with went missing so im kinda sketchy about that too. Im on the fence right now but im for sure not staying in but im not sure what to do.

What do you guys do when you go out alone? How do you have fun? I have gone out alone but usually its after i am already in a good mood.

BONUS QUESTION: Say you went out alone and you bumped into the same people that said they already had plans and they asked if you could drive them home or something. Would you?



UPDATE: So i did end up going out alone and had a pretty good time. Basically i wen tout and saw the same people i wouldve gone out with anyway and we did the same thing ecept a few perks

1.) I didnt feel like i was obligated to keep up with them and make sure they were good.

2.) I could leave anytime i wanted

3.) I felt a bit more confident because even though i came in alone all these groups of people were coming overing talking to me.

4.) One of them did ask me for a ride and i made him pay me 20 bucks for gas. So all in all i went out for free


ONly down side was i couldnt drink. The next few days i had a few people asking me how my weekend was and what i did. I would recommend this to people as opposed to always going out in a group. Im for sure doing it more often

title: When a guy is into you, but you struggle with body image.
body:
Hi guys!

I (31F) have been single since right before 2020 and that time was 100% pure focus on getting to know myself and be alone for awhile, and I was/am fine with that! My last relationship I was in messed with my confidence. He attempted to cheat on me once, called me disgusting before we broke up, and started dating a rando from our apartment complex almost immediately after we broke up.

However, I have been on a weight loss journey and honestly feel great! But, now there are *new* things I don't love when I look at my body in the mirror. So, I start going to the gym to better myself for myself, and here's comes a guy who's reallyy into me (and vice versa) but I can't shake the feeling of being comfortable in my own skin.

I want to reiterate that it's not actual confidence I'm worried about, it's just the way I feel about my own body and letting go.

I truly want to know how men go about being into women who may have these types of problems, but also how do you feel about women who are going through this but, enjoy her regardless? Words of encouragement?

This is truly truly bumming me out and I think therapy would be helpful but I seem to have it stuck in my mind that my body this way is gross and there's no way someone could be into me right now.

TYIA

title: How do I move on from meeting someone incredible but is not going to go anywhere?
body:
I met someone really great. 

G = girl. She is actually a woman but the feeling I was getting from, and for her, girl seems more appropriate and I don’t want to type “she” talking about her too often.

Anyway I met this girl. It was very organic, met in a grocery store, explained to her I was only in town for work for a few more days, got her phone number. 

We texted some and she had a little bit of time between engagements the following evening so we went for a drink. She picked me up as I didn’t have a vehicle. I was very upfront when I got in and told her I felt like kissing her almost from the get go. Anyway long story a little shorter the date went well and we kissed and touched in her car as we left. 
After I was dropped off G went to dinner and we texted a little more and she came back to the apartment I was in and we had sex. Like great sex. G was very open and comfortable and confident, young at heart with warm wild eyes (hence calling her girl. Made me feel younger than I have for a long time) She was a squirter and we had fun leaving wet spots all over my bed. G had a great body and beautiful face, very natural and very sexy. 

Anyway, this was the best sex I have possibly ever had. Physically yes, but there was more to it, and the more to it is the reason for this post. 
We only had the one night together but I am left thinking about her. I know it is impossible for anything to become of us. We texted each other for a few days after I returned home but no more. I haven’t heard anything from her in over a fortnight, the last 2 messages left unreplied. I feel like something is lost. A genuine sadness. How do I get over this and move forward without remaining this low. I felt such a great connection with this girl and  it hurts to feel like it’s just done.

title: Being (24M) accused of being too sensitive as a man by my S/O (26F)—what to do?
body:
Long-term lurker, first time poster. Feels weird writing the following... because my previous ideas of "being a man" meant not sharing my emotions with anybody, especially other men. Screw it. Here goes.

I've been dating my S/O for about 12 months and we're getting to the stage of the relationship where we're beginning to squabble here and there. One of the sore spots in our relationship is the above: that is, I've come to find that I feel real insecure about bringing up my feelings to my girlfriend.

Now, I know I'm not "soft" by any traditional means: I'm 6'4" 230lbs, former college linebacker, and work as head of security for a rather large-sized building. Come from a family of hard-nosed immigrants that'd smack your head if you complained, which is why I'm having a hard time being forthcoming with my emotions.. especially being accused of being over-sensitive.

**A couple of examples**:

* We were out for drinks with a couple of her friends. Her friends said something along the lines of "Yeah, you've gotta be mentally fucked in the head to join the military, the police force, or a firefighting crew. Or just really stupid." Now being that I have a number of friends in said occupations (and me being outspoken), I brought it up to my S/O later that I thought that was a stupid and oblivious comment to make. She then commences to say that she doesn't understand why I can't "just get along" with her friends and that she thinks I'm being overly-sensitive.
* When we first started dating exclusively (yes, this monogamy was agreed upon), she said she was going to go on a "getaway trip" with her gay best friend, since college, one-on-one a couple hours before leaving. A little annoyed that she didn't give me the heads up earlier but whatever. She comes back and tells me that they accidentally booked at an uber-Christian B&B so she and her gay best friend had to hold hands, call each other honey, etc, in order to get a room together (they had to pretend as if they were a couple). I brought up the fact that I felt "uncomfortable" and she told me "Oh my GOD are you being serious snowflake? \[Eye roll\]".
* And as of last weekend: she met my parents over dinner and afterwards, said something to the effect of "Whew, glad that's over. Now that if I had a reason to break up with you because I didn't like your family, that's no longer a reason." Cue me getting tilted ("who says shit like that" I literally said to her) because of her behaving as if she said nothing wrong with that comment.

There are a number more anecdotes just like this.

Things have been great, and she really is a wonderful person, but it's coming to the point where I feel really... **emotionally** dismissed. It's weird typing that as the person I am but that's the truest representation of how I feel. **I have brought this up** a couple of times in the past but it seems as if it's the same cycle: she either dismisses my bringing it up as over-sensitivity **or** she promises she'll change, I promise I'll communicate more tactfully, and then... I get accused of being over-sensitive one way or another a week or two later.

**TL;DR**: I think I'm valid in my grievances, girlfriend shuts my feelings down and labels it over-sensitivity. Unsure how to proceed or bring it up..

title: Family and friends call me crazy for wanting to stick through this relationship... What do you think?
body:
So I (20M) met this wonderful girl (20F) who I really care for and love spending time with. During the first 2 months of our relationship things were perfect. We opened up to each other and she had told me she has major depressive disorder and generalized anxiety disorder. I am 100% okay with this.


However, she said she has been depressed and she doesn't want me to see her upset like that even though I have before. We haven't seen each other in two weeks due to the fact that she is upset and doesn't want me to see her. Some days we'll have plans and she'll back out last minute saying she wants to stay home and collect her thoughts, but later in the night she'll tell me she's going out drinking with her best friend.


She blocked my number without warning and I haven't tried to contact her since the day she did that (Friday afternoon). I think I'm falling for this girl and I am thinking of just giving her space to figure this out but my friends and family are telling me I am crazy for doing this... What do you, /r/AskMen, think?

title: [17M] Delayed puberty and self conscious abouy size
body: Hi so I will be 17 in under a month. During my 8th year of school I was diagnosed with Crohn's disease. Basically my lower intestine is infected and very scarred. It means that until I was diagnosed and started to receive treatment, I was not absorbing most of the nutrients I needed. During elementary school, I was one of, if not the tallest in my class. Then towards the end of middle school I stopped growing and became one of the shortest. Finally during my sophomore year it started to become under control and I started gaining the nutrients I needed. So because of this, I had a delayed puberty. So now I am finally growing, currently 5'11" and 150lbs. Yet I am self conscious about my penis size. I am about 2-2.5 inches soft and 4.5 max when erect. By now (I am currently a junior) everyone, including myself, is interested in the opposite sex and many are already having sex. I am sort of on the quiet side but still talk to girls and have joked around before. I've been talking to this one girl and she's joked about "sucking my dick" and I kind of joke too. While I would love to mess around with this girl whether it's just oral or full on sex, I'm just self conscious about my penis size. I don't want to sit down and explain my delayed puberty, but I'm very interested in girls and like this girl. Any help or suggestions? Is 4.5" erect small for 17? I'm not some experienced master, so please help. Please only serious replies. Thanks.

title: When does lack of emotional support become an issue?
body:
I’ve been with my guy for 4 months and we see each other about 3 times a week when he’s not working away. We text all day, everyday but the problem is it’s not a deep conversation. When we are in person we talk about everything and nothing is off limits, texting not so much. 

He’s away at the moment and I’m a bit stressed out due to work and the housing market (we live apart). I told him I’d be quiet for a bit and talk to him later and his response was not a problem. 

Is 4 months too early too expect a deeper level of emotional support? I feel he could have at least asked if I’m alright.

title: Is it a red flag that the man I am dating won't speak to me over an NFL game?
body:
Context on our situation:

We are in our late 20s. We are in the beginning stages of dating; ~4 months in. Haven't officially discussed exclusivity, but for the sake of discussion and simplicity let's say we are steadily approaching that level. However... still in that fragile getting to know each other's strengths and flaws stage. This is also long distance; that could be an important fact.


Details of my questions:

Our teams are HUGE rivals. Whenever they play each other we both talk shit; it's a lot of fun, and we love to talk about how "taboo" we are. Anyway, his team lost to mine last night, AT their home field, in the playoffs. I did NOT rub it in because as much as I love football, he cares way more than I do. In fact, I didn't text a single thing to him during or post game. I respect him enough to not be a douche bag about it. 


However now he won't talk to me. He literally told me he won't, and he is following through. At first I considered it a continuation of our running "sleeping with the enemy" joke, but he's taken it to a new level with punishing me for a football game... I feel ridiculous even verbalizing that this is an issue, but should I consider it a red flag in his behavior? I have no idea when he will text/call me again. He's effectively ruined my enjoyment of my teams victory by acting like a sore, salty-ass loser and I'm afraid that if I were to eventually be in a relationship with this person, this pouty behavior would be too common and cause problems. Do I tell him now that he is making me feel sad that now I can't even talk to the one person I want to? Or do I wait for him to finish licking his wounds?


On the other hand, am I thinking too much about it? I am prone to that, which is why I bring this question to the collective here. Thanks if you read this, I appreciate any feedback.

title: How do you guys feel stable/manage your anger?
body: 21 m, wondering how y’all emotionally regulate and be consistently emotionally stable in a healthy way. something like controlling my emotions within the moment and not saying something i’ll end up regretting towards my partner and keeping myself regulated and stable during either stressful or overwhelming events within my life or feelings I experience. not really looking for answers that involve playing video games or exercising (unless that’s actually fully and one hundred percent healthy to do) or doing something you like as that just comes off as emotionally buffering at that point imo.

title: What could this interaction mean? I don’t really understand men, especially playful ones
body:
We’re 22 and I (F) work in a male dominated space so I’m like the only girl he really talks to. We hung out outside work in a group twice. I’ve been trying to get to know him more and catch signs of him maybe being into me but it’s been kinda mixed. So far he’s truly just friendly. He’s a playful guy, at least with his guy friends

Well he was playing smash recently with some guys when me and another friend were nearby talking. His back was to us, controller in his hands. He turned around to look at us and we made eye contact. I didn’t look away and he just smiled, made this playful face, and shrugged so I smiled and did the same thing. He did it again. We just kinda stood there looking at each other, smiling, and shrugging?? I got kinda embarrassed and looked away, pretended to be distracted.

I’ve come to the conclusion that he probably sees me as one of the guys or is simply just comfy with me now, idk. I would think he’d be more flustered if he actually liked me.

I would like the opinion of men, if possible

title: [25m] How do I make a smooth transition from dating to FWB?
body:
Late bloomer here. I've been on a few casual dates with a girl [23f] in my classes but I am very conflicted on what to do now.

There is clear chemistry and sexual tension between us and I would definitely like to hook up with her. 

She texts/snapchats me often when we are not hanging out and we get along pretty well.

However, we are at different stages in life and I am not looking for a committed relationship right now. We both live with our parents. She just graduated yesterday and has a job locked down and I still have a semester left plus the task of finding a job after that. Obviously the main goal right now is to move the hell out of my parents house before starting any sort of serious thing with a girl.

Couple things I am worried about:

- She already calls me "babe"--albeit via text, but that still makes me a bit nervous and shows that she may be more invested in this than I am. We haven't even kissed yet.

- She wants me to come out to dinner and some bars this weekend with her "family and friends". Call me an asshole but I do not want to do that.

Here is the issue--I like her and am sexually attracted to her, but I am 100% NOT looking for a girlfriend. On the other hand, I see no reason why we shouldn't casually date, hook up, hang out whenever.

Can any guys who have started an FWB-type deal with a girl offer some advice on how to let her know that I only want something casual right now? 

Should I just let sex happen naturally and then have "the talk" the morning after? Should I take her out for coffee and tell her before anything happens?

I realize that she's a grown-ass woman and can handle her shit, but I just want to go about this in a reasonable way without fucking with her emotions.

title: I have $2500 that I want to spend on finding a girlfriend. How would you spend it?
body:
So I am a guy who just recently had my first date / girlfriend at 34.  She broke it up with me saying she didn't have those feelings anymore.  Well it was a blow to my system, and somewhat still feels bad.  I would like to find someone to spend time with, and overall love me as much as I love them.  The problem is that I fear the only time I will ever hug, cuddle, or have sex with another women is with an escort.  I have the money for it but I feel like the only thing that will be going through my head would be they are only there because I am paying them.  So instead I am setting aside $2500 (obviously more if I am in a relationship) to find someone.  I feel like human chum with so many women holding out for attractive guys only.  I am an average looking guy.

So how would you guys do it?  Should I give up all together?  Move to another state or even country where women are OK with dating someone who looks like me (see below for my stats)?

Here are some of my stats

* Best physical condition of my life (hiking, taking dog out on walks, climbing)

* I have all of my hair (I keep it clean)

* Custom dress shirts and nice jeans are my goto outfit because I am comfortable in both

* 6 ft.

* Driven to a goal professionally

* I am not a millionaire but I have a steady job (paying the bills) and two startups that I get some extra money for but looking to expand

Disclaimers

* I am half black / half white (tan) and I currently live in Minnesota

* So far all women that I have asked on dates in Minnesota have so far said "I am not their type." or the fun, "Let's just be friends."  Most have ghosted me all together.  Once I was told that she, "Didn't date black people."  Overall, I think women here stick to their own race.

* I have tried the "don't look for anyone," and, "stop looking and they will fall into your lap", it hasn't worked for the past decade :)

* I have lived in Minnesota most of my life

What I have tried

* OkCupid, eHarmony (not currently on either because almost no responses)

* Take my dog out on walks

* Some social meetups

title: How did you deal with losing your father at a young age?
body: I miss my dad a lot and today is a tougher one for me in particular. It’s been over two years but I still think about him constantly and it doesn’t take a lot for me to just break down and cry. Does “normal” ever come back? This place I’m in feels endless.... I miss having a masculine figure in my life to turn to for advice

title: What was your experience living on a college campus?
body:
So I am a Sophomore in college. My current situation is that I live at home which is an hour away from campus, which is in downtown Chicago. I commute twice a week and just chill/work/study on the other days at home, an hour away.

Honestly, I have barely made any friends and even the ones I have, I cannot go to events or hang out because I do not plan to drive or commute an hour each way just for that consistently.

So of course, there is living on campus. I could get an apartment in downtown Chicago or share one with roommates. I calculated that a full school year of on-campus living will set me back $25k, most of it going towards loans.

So of these two options below, which do you recommend?

Option A: Keep living at home and commuting

* Cheaper option and the one that brings the most ease and comfort
* This means that building connections and relationships will continue to be super hard
* Losing college experience overall

Option B: Move to Campus

* Expensive (+$25k debt) and less comfortable compared to living at home
* Can get full college experience and build friendships/connections
* Get to live in downtown Chicago

Any advice would be greatly appreciated! Thanks!

title: What's the fire that wakes you up in the morning?
body: Ever since the start of the pandemic, I've lost access to most social opportunities I previously had at college and became less invested in the hobbies and interests which took up most of my time/thoughts/energy. Now, I've gotten locked into a routine of waking up, doing my classes, getting some chores and exercise out of the way, and going to bed. I can hardly see my friends, when I do I have virtually nothing to talk about since practically nothing changes for better or worse in my life. There's no fire in what I do and there's almost nothing I look forward to with excitement these days. Really, I feel like my life has been put on hold and it's been dragging my self-confidence through the dirt as of late. Anyone felt the same way and rediscover the fire?

title: How do I get better at picking up women/interacting in general without even the slightest foundation?
body:
In weight training, to get better at a particular movement, you start at a low weight and do it a lot of times until you can do more weight. I try to put that into practice in most everything I do. Don't know much about the ancient Assyrians? Read a book with a wide scope, and narrow it down. Wanna learn to fold awesome origami? Start with the easiest thing and work your way up. Makes a lot of sense, doesn't it?

Now I want to do the same with human beings. I want to get better at interacting with people, and to be more precise, at picking up women. But I don't know how to improve my skills. And I have no foundation to build from. Obviously, a lot of interaction and pick-up attempts and failing over and over again will lead to one getting better at it, but it's seems a bit shitty to me. When it came to weight training, I did a lot of reading before starting out to lay a solid foundation of knowledge so that I'd know beforehand what to do and not to do. And once I came around to actually starting out, I started with a low weight and worked my way up. Trying to randomly interact with people seems like a whole lot of stabbing in the dark.

When it comes to people, I have virtually no foundation. I was a weird kid - fat, ugly and dorky so I never had many friends, and thus missed out on a lot of crucial social practice. I assume there's not gonna be much *useful* theory behind interaction because people's psyches are a lot more fickle than their muscles. I'm a shitty conversationalist and boring as all hell and don't know how to improve that.

I just... I dunno. Is there a way of getting better at these sorts of things without basically trying everything out? Social aficionados, I'd love to hear you out.

TL;DR I suck at people how do I get better, yes I know practice makes better

title: How do you overcome constant failures and stress from uncertainity knowing that no one is having your back?
body:
26f doctor here, as a woman i know our family and friends watch our back much more than for boys, not saying that boys dont have friends but i have seen boys/Men experiencing a lot of left-out feeling in their lives, who dont have such people to look for them

So tell me how did you all bounce-back from the constant failures and how did you overcome the feeling of getting left-out when everyone was either moving ahead or when you were feeling stuck due to failures.

Thankyou

title: Disability, anxiety, and dating/hookups. May I have some advice on all fronts, no matter how much you can/can't relate please?
body:
Sorry! This post ended up being much longer than I expected, but I feel like it's all pretty important because I still have these issues/thoughts about anyone and everyone else that I'm interested in. And a lot of this sounds like you have to explain it to me like I'm a five year old, and I'd honestly prefer it if you did. I'll always be willing to look dumb in the pursuit of improvement. I'm hoping that this is just a unique enough situation to warrant this post not violating rule 4.

I'm a 26 year old physically disabled guy. I have a muscular condition, which is essentially like ALS, but not AS severe in my case. Because I've been shy and anxious ever since I can remember, I never really got "broken out of my shell". On Tinder I've switched up the way I interact with women. In essence, I do my best to entirely ignore my anxiety and just go balls to the wall with my personality and I say things that are completely fine (likely) to say, but if I listened to my anxiety, I would never. It's working out pretty well! Fake it til you make it style.

However, at the end of the day, I still do have anxiety, and I'm even more inexperienced than you can imagine. For example, I'm not physically strong enough to do the five knuckle shuffle myself, so nudes don't really do much for me. I mean. They do, but I can't do anything about it which has led me to basically look at nudes through an artistic appreciation lens if that makes any sense. Anxiety, the no 5 knuckle shuffle, and the inexperience make me absolutely fucking awful at dirty talk. (How do you all know what they want to hear during impromptu dirty talk that you initiate?) So! I of course second guess myself a lot. Some of these questions might have painfully obvious answers, but, again, anxiety. And others aren't as obvious, but I would love to hear people's thoughts.

I know that I don't look all that attractive physically to most, but I don't even care about that, because if just my looks are a deal breaker, then I consider that a dodged bullet for sure. A lot of my charm is my jokes and me being smooth. I do super well over text, but thinking about saying certain stuff in person with my limitations doesn't sound very smooth. For example, I've been talking to a girl on Tinder for a few weeks and I've told her that given the opportunity, I would love to "tap that ass into orbit". That was also pretty early on, she's still seemingly interested, and she lives about 40 miles away. She plans on coming here to hang out soon. Tonight I asked her to send me a wet hair selfie after her shower because "wet hair selfies make my knees go weak". Smooth, right? She sent me a selfie where you can tell that she meticulously showed more than she "had" to, but covered her nipple with her hair. I called her out in a joking/teasing way and she all but said that she was teasing me.

She's a super cool person. Super adventurous type. I asked her if she wanted to see a movie, get dinner, chill at my place or tie a skateboard to the back of my chair and cruise around Walmart and she goes "Why not all of the above?" which gave me a raging heart-on. She's a goofball like I am.

Now. Here's where my mental block is. Being funny and smooth is my best moves besides manufactured confidence. Because of my disability, I can't really move much. So I can't really initiate anything in the most traditional ways. I have to use my words. "Hey wanna fuck?" or "let me kiss you" just doesn't...sound smooth or charming when I imagine it. Am I just too into my own head about it? Or, preferably, can you guys think of any more in character (funny/witty) ways to ask?

That's the difficult one. I seem to be doing well at knowing when someone is interested and is/or flirting. But if you guys have any thoughts on what I should look for in that area too, that would be super appreciated! Even if you feel like it's blatantly obvious, please do share still. Because besides the fake it til you make it part, I sincerely don't have any fucking clue what I'm doing even if it seems like I do. On her Tinder bio she said that she wasn't looking for anything serious, but she also deleted her account too. So even if someone isn't looking for something serious, they have the potential to find it anyway.

Probably another very obvious answer, but I want to make sure from people who are far more experienced than myself. I early on mentioned tapping that ass into orbit, her profile originally said nothing serious, she sent me flirty photos, and she's going to drive 40 miles to hang out with me. Is it pretty safe to assume that she's down to have her ass tapped into orbit? That distance sucks, but I'm also definitely capable of getting to her as well.

And just advice in general in this area would be fantastic. How to pick up girls in general. Honestly anything you can think of. Pretend I'm your son and you're teaching me how to ride a bike that I didn't even know existed.

Again, I apologize for the lengthy post! I've wondered about a lot of this for a LONG time.

title: Is this relationship worth fighting for?
body:
I'm 19 and I have been dating the same girl for over two and a half years. We had a great relationship starting out, but it has deteriorated. She has a baby with someone else, and I have stuck by her side through everything. Because of this, she has become consistently more crabby, bitchy, and overall terrible to me. She's realized it and realized she needs to get help. She got frustrated recently and broke up with me (Sept 29th.) We had plans to meet the following Monday (Oct 6th) to talk about it. Throughout that next week she had texted me saying she still loves me, we're going to be together, she just needs some space to herself. So the 6th comes around, we talk, officially get back together and I see what looks like a hickey on her neck. She denies it by saying that her son hit her with a car and left a bruise. She promises on his life that nothing happened. I am very suspicious, but I have no reason not to believe her. A week later (Oct 13th) I was showing her something on her phone and I saw her search "how to get rid of a hickey" on Oct 5th, which was a day before we planned on hanging out. She denied it yet again, saying she had a friend at work who did not have internet and was looking it for her. Now too suspicious, I tell her I need some time to think about what I wanted to do. I gave her an ultimatum of either a) Confessing it, working through it and we could talk it over (complete bs, wanted a confession) or b) i would think about it and let her know what I decided.

She ultimately admitted to it. She went to a friend's house for her 21st birthday party. Apparently made out with a guy while drunk, went to the bathroom and then cried her eyes out for what she did. 

Basically my main question is if I would have done the same thing in her situation. I have broken up with her before, and have came very close to messing around with other girls, yet it never happened. 

Is it worth trying to work through it together? Or should I just move on with my life? 

EDIT: I guess I can add how she acted after she told me. She cried her eyes out saying it was the biggest mistake of her life. Not knowing what she had in front of her. To be honest, I am an amazing boyfriend to her and I've done anything I can for her. And she was super upset at herself, apologizing, wanted to try and work through it to which I did not want to at the time. A few days have gone by and I do miss her, but I'm not sure if this is something I could get over. 

Sorry about the wall of text. TL;DR: Gf of 2.5 years, broke up, "Cheated" on me, lied, broke up with her, should I try to salvage the relationship?

title: What are some things that your wife/partner does to make you feel like a priority after you've had kids?
body:
Me(30F) and my partner(36M) have been together for the better part of the last 7 years and we have a 5 year old son together. 

Since the end of September he's been living at his moms an hour away because I couldn't handle him being in our house anymore. He had become so negative, lazy, undependable and started undermining me every chance he got when it came to parenting. I was so sure I was done with the relationship as he seemed unwilling to try to talk and attempt to work through our problems even though he kept saying he didn't want to break up. 

Well we got into a big fight in the beginning of this month and he finally opened up to me (which I know is really hard for him to do) and he told me that he's been feeling resentful towards me for a long time. He feels as though once I became a mom, I stopped being his partner. That I put all of myself into our son and our home and I don't leave anything left for him. That our relationship has become me telling him what to do and treating him more like an employee than my partner. 

I feel like such an arsehole. Since he told me that, it's all I can see. I was 24 when I got pregnant and once I had our son I knew I had to grow up so I kind of faked it until you make it kind of thing. It's like I hyper focused on being a mom and nothing else and of course having a kid makes it very hard to get any alone time so I must have just let our relationship fade into the background. 

I love this man with every part of me and I have since the moment I laid eyes on him and honestly I never intended for things to go this way so  I'm looking for any advice on ways I can make him feel like/show him I care about him and that our relationship is important to me. Or behaviors I should be changing, traditions/habits I could start so he knows I prioritize him (example could be making his favorite meal every whatever day of the month, so even if that day is a day that I'm exhausted, he knows that I still made it because I love him) 

I've only been able to think of things from a womans perspective so I'm hoping some of you can tell me what you would like as a man or what has your SO done to make you feel like a priority. I know what I'm asking may sound confusing but hopefully you can understand it enough Haha 

Please keep in mind that he's a recovering alcoholic so nothing to do with drinking or going out to a bar ect. We've also never hired a babysitter or left our son with family so that we could have time to ourselves but I would be willing to do so if you think it would help.

title: How do you overcome the anxiety durring sex with a woman that you might get ther pregnant even with protection on? Or you never had such a problem?
Do guys talk to each other about cheating on their SO even if its not in their hearts?
body: A while back I got into my bf's fb messages between him and his best friend.  They messages were so horrifying to me, saying things like "I like her and shes a good girl and all but pussy is pussy".  Also some conversation about getting a BJ from a local prostitute, but the back and forth in the conversation was such 'real talk' that I still cannot get it out of my head.  I discovered these messages about 3 months ago or more.  My bf and I have been dating for almost a year now.  When I broke the news of what I read, he was out of town, not knowing I could still see the messages and I watched the conversation with his friend as he said "SHe saw messages about us going to bang Tanya"  and "Idk what to do, I'm fucked.  She caught me red handed".   He insists that it was all just guy talk and he would never cheat on me, no matter how terrible it sounds it was not 'real' talk bc that is just how "guys talk".  I shared the actual messages (because I took pictures of them) with my best cousin who is a guy and another guy I really trust, and they felt it was also just how guys talk.  So where do I draw the line in trusting my heart that my guy really loves me and would never do anything to hurt me, that it was really just talk and we have nothing to worry about?  It is hard for people to unsee, unread these kinds of things, so it often makes me feel afraid that my bf would not "turn down pussy if he can get away with it".  Because on the other hand, if he is a womanizer in his heart and I let him off after "being caught red handed", then what does that say about me???  That I'm stupid and he can cheat on me if ever given the opportunity??  Ugh, sorry for dragging on, I'm just so unsettled on this.  It doesn't come up every day, but something will remind me of it sometimes and I can't get it out of my head.

title: When have you had success in your life that just makes you feel bored?
body:
It's hard to describe this feeling, so here's some backstory.

I'm in my mid 20s and to date my life has been pretty tough. I won't bore you with details, but let's just say I grew up HARD and it was very difficult for me to find my feet and actually progress.

But that all changed a year ago. Comparatively speaking my life is amazing. Good job, money, my own nice place and friends and hobbies and really everything I didn't have. Better still, my family's life is better. I am able to look after them now too so my parents and siblings are doing great even though they had it just as tough.

Sometimes I think about how great it all is, but at the same time it all feels kind of... Bland? Like I go to work and I'm bored, come home, hang out with friends, do things - bored. It's like there's nothing really going on.

When I think back to when things were bad it just seems more vivid. The anger and frustration and sadness was more real, but at the same time the exciting and happy bits were more real too. All that while I was striving to get where I am now, and now I'm here and it's like, is that all?

So yeah. Things are outstanding right now but I'm not feeling it. It's important to say that I'm not depressed or sad or anything  like that. It's just this weird tastelessness.

It's hard to explain and I feel like a dick for complaining about my life being too good... But I dunno its weird. Kind of feel like I am attending my bodily functions each day while spending all my money on random STUFF that I don't even want or need. No joy or sorrow. Just weird man. 


Anyone else ever experience anything like that?

title: F(26) My relatively new boyfriend wants to become a male stripper. . .what should I do?
body:
Initially he asked when we first started dating about two months ago, and because I wanted to be open minded about it I said ok.  

He hasn't had a "gig" until now and now that he has the opportunity and I'm kinda panicking . . . mostly because 
I've heard and read about what goes on in female bachelorette parties.  Which in my mind varies VASTLY from my naive idea that it's mostly women being danced on and giggling about the sillyness of it all.

My problem is that I'm extremely umcomfortable about the idea of him getting sexual favors even though he swears up and down he wouldn't allow it.  I know a lot of it comes down to trust, but I really need some advice because I like him a lot and don't want to be flippant in breaking up with him.  Is there is anybody out there who has made this kind of thing work?  And how did things end up?

UPDATE:  Thank you everyone for your kind advice, I received a ton of great suggestions.  After being honest with him, and voicing my concerns he decided he won't.  :)  Thanks again!

title: Should you allow yourself to feel happy when you are working toward getting to where we want to be?
body:
Massive struggle of mine. I just graduated University and I am looking toward changing cities and getting a high paying job. I recently lost my job because the company was downsizing. I don't have my own place yet, and am not really where I want to be, but I know where I want to be and will eventually get there. That said, I find that I don't allow myself to enjoy life, because I don't feel like I deserve it, because I am not where I want to be. I won't date women because I am not where I want to be, I won't experience things fully because do I deserve to enjoy this thing, when I don't have a job, my own place? 

I am convinced that it will all change when I get that job, and get that place and get to where I want to be. Is this a trap?

title: Men who had to choose between love and comfort - what happened? Do you regret it?
body:
Currently have been living an absolutely tremendous life - single, young, big city full of beautiful women.  I have had 0 plans of settling down here at all.

I’ve been seeing a girl for about a year. We tried dating. But honestly she’s just not for me, we click and we have a good time, but she’s not very intelligent and we have 0 connection aside from sex, weed, and food. I care for her deeply, in a weird way like a little sister? We dated for a while, but ultimately I don’t reciprocate her feelings. She still loves me I know

About a month ago, I met the most incredible woman ever. Absolutely gorgeous. Sharp as a tack. Just someone who understands me, she accepts everything about me. I was smitten within hours of meeting her, I’m pretty much in love with her now and I know she feels similarly. She’s perfect. I can see us together for years to come.

But I can’t lose either one of them. And I know dating this new girl would mean losing the former. And as much as I love her, I can’t take the risk of losing the first girl. But fuck I feel like I’ll think about this girl for years if I don’t take this chance on her. She straight up told me last night that I was being an idiot and making a stupid decision.

At this point I’ve decided not making a decision, is the best decision to make. But I know the second girl is growing frustrated.

Just want to see how anyone else has handled it I guess.

title: How do you not feel envious of people who had good upbringings when you didn't?
body:
At age 2, I was placed on the autism spectrum, and as such, would frequently attend therapies throughout my life, had an aide through elementary and parts of middle school, and struggled to make friends. I was the outcast. I'm approaching 23 with zero dating history, now looking to find a romantic partner, but have come up empty handed. 

It seems like LITERALLY EVERYONE my age has had plenty of friends and some dating history except me, so it's hard to connect with people. Even when I find someone who has a shy personality, out of nowhere they bring up a lover they have/had. I'm scared to make friends and talk to the few friends I do have meaningfully cause I'm afraid I'll find out they have/had a girlfriend. I already get envious when they bring up having friends, even though I have literally had some throughout my life.

I just get so envious. Think of it like this. People like me are the small business, the local burger joint, have gone through struggles, and are genuine and easier to connect with. People with successful social lives are McDonald's, Disney, Jeff Bezos, the soulless megacorporations. They're nepo babies who were handed everything on a silver platter. If something bad happens to them, it's nothing cause they've got all the wealth/friends in the world. They got the opportunity to have a proper social life. I did not.

I wasn't like abused or anything, in fact my parents were too lenient if anything, leading to me becoming an asshat at times. I just was not raised normally and have suffered because of it. I highly doubt I'd be able to sue for the damages.

title: I am finally quitting bodybuilding due to how badly It has messed my life up.
body:
Everyone knows about positive side of bodybuilding but you'll get to know how devastating it can be for mentally vulnerable people like me, The idea that you've to sleep for 7-8hrs every night for optimal muscle growth made me obsess over my sleep hours incessantly where in the beginning I would panic If I got any less than 8hrs but gradually It turned into Anxiety induced Insomnia.

Waking up everyday after suboptimal sleep and feeling guilty for fucking up my gains then worrying again for not being able to sleep next night has spiralled my mental peace to hell.

Its my fault, My inherent mindset fault, should have worked on my fucked up brain first before starting bodybuilding. 
I'm not slandering Bodybuilding in anyway just admitting that my doomed thought process has forced me to resort to letting it all go so that I could learn to think like a normal person again and not immediately have the Persistent thought of fucking up my gains upon waking up.

title: Men, how do you know if a female wants to give it another shot or is completely done with you?
body:
Recently received this from a female I’m interested in and I don’t know how to proceed: 


“I really need to let this out. I don’t care if you’re going to judge me because I can’t hold this in anymore. When you ghosted me in January, I felt really bad about it. I’ve never been on a lot of dates so it was kinda a big deal for me to go out with you alone. Out of everyone I coups go out with, I chose you because I really really liked you. I legit told all my besties and even my mom that I’m finally going out with a guy after a 2 year long hiatus and then you do that. I was almost gonna book my Uber when you stopped replying to me and I was so heart broken when the realisation hit me that I’d been ghosted. I’d have understood if it was me who was behind you but you were the one that asked me out 4 times until I said yes, and you then you do that. It was so embarrassing and hurtful when my friends would text me “how’s it going?” because they assumed I was there. I didn’t sleep that night, I was so hurt that I cried the whole time and I’d check my phone at every buzz thinking it was you. You didn’t talk to me until the end of February and I’m mad at myself for even talking to you after you came back without even apologising. It’s just each time you text me, I automatically look at you through a negative light and over analyse everything because I can’t take you seriously at all which makes me snap at everything.”

title: Is it better to go off on fake friends or no? Why or why not?
body:
I am almost 25 and I still struggle with anger issues and trust issues. I had a fallout with some close friends and it made me distrust everyone that was close to me. As a result, I hadn’t had a single relationship last long in the past few years. It makes me think there is something wrong with me as I always used to have friends. 

I resorted to friends after college who rarely would hit me up to chill. I’d always have to hit them up. Eventually I got booted from the group due to beef with some members. I got into a tussle with a guy for play and ended up getting hurt. I told him and he just made it seem like I was overreacting.  After that I distrusted the whole group. 

I ended up not keeping in touch with the group much recently. I had some close childhood friends in that group, but they’d rather chill with them than me nowadays. As soon as I sensed this, I developed some hate towards my former friends.

Nowadays, I get drunk and try and solve issues through text with friends. It has made me create a toxic relationship towards friends. Now I’m willing to call out friends for their fake ness as soon as shit hit the fan. I’m tired of fake friends and I’m aggressively trying to lose them.

I don’t know if this is good or not. I can tell when a friend eventually turns into an acquaintance because they’d rather chill with new people and not bother keeping in touch with me. And it’s not always their fault I guess, sometimes they are so busy to reply.

But it always hits me personally. So I end up drinking a lot one night, and venting my concerned about the relationship to all these friends. But they look at me like I’m crazy and gives them more of a reason to avoid me. For instance, my friend went on a trip this past weekend, they didn’t even mention it to me. They had planned it behind my back and they didn’t even care enough to include me. I don’t even like to call them my friends because I know deep down they don’t care.

 The thing is that the one guy who I’m closest with, hits me up when it’s convenient for him. But he doesn’t hit me up otherwise unless I remind him. He even told me he was busy last weekend, he posts on his story chilling with a friend and his gf. But he tells me he couldn’t chill, which just makes me have trust issues. The truth is that I can’t connect with them without weed or beer so it makes me think of I’m truly their friends.

title: What do you do when you have a nervous breakdown / panik attack?
body:
I just had a minor eposide this morning, could calm it down with my wife and 2mg of Lorazepam.
Now I am sitting at work again. Canned to the brim to feel good and no idea how I can change my workbehaviour.
I just need another job. I am made to work in a team, not alone in a office and the only thing anybody asks for is every three years when the authorities are on their way.

My job is made for a person who procrastinates things that are not important at the moment. It can be so easily done and nobody cares. Nobody cares except one guy every 3 years.
If just one other person would at least check the shit once a year for a day it would be so much easier for me. Or a colleague, for who there is enough space.
But I am sitting here, doing what I can do, trying to figure myself out, getting fucking panic attacks and nervous breakdowns every couple of weeks for apparently no reason to everyone else.
It is just work. Yeah...

I think I need another job.

title: Experience has shown me that my looks + personality make me boyfriend, but not hookup material. I am obsessed with the latter, and uninterested in the former. What do?
body:
Title says all.

Looks are not my strongest point. I am short (5'6"), have receding hair, and average face. I am not unpleasant to look at, but not hot/sexy.

Personality wise, I am quite reserved with people I do not know, take sometime to open up. When I do, I am fun, mature, whatever; but it takes time.

It goes without saying that I am not making panties drop. I have genuinely attractive male acquaintances and I see how ladies treat them just based on their looks without them even opening their mouths. I do not have that.

I do not know where that leaves me. I feel that I am a failure for failing to attract women on superficial terms (I am dead serious). I get angry every time a woman says that I am a good man, amazing family guy, more mature than the other men, different than all the pump-and-dump guys, and so on. I won't lie, I have lead a couple of them just for sex, only to listen how I am an asshole like all the other guys.

I am pissed that I am mainly perceived as a bf. I am pissed that I am not perceived as someone who wants, and can get, sex just for the sake of sex.

I am so obsessed with this that I decided to never have children; I do not want them to inherit my looks and suffer in this culture obsessed with superficial sex.

I cannot go on like this. This is on my mind all the time. I cannot focus on my career. When I think I should do, I find myself asking: For what? What am I building a career for?

title: What are some stories or examples of guys getting back together with an ex who had gotten married and then divorced?
body:
I know this is a silly question, but I’m going through some pretty bad grief right now over an ex I have a lot of attachment and PTSD stuff over. 

I am seeing a therapist for it, 2 actually, but I also had a pretty traumatic experience lately with a therapist I was pretty attached to as well compounding this.

Kind of what we’ve talked about so far, is the idea that it’s okay to have a little hope left, but it can’t be the primary/only hope I have left, still gotta move on and pursue other options etc. But it’s still hurting pretty bad at the moment.

title: Men whose SO has mental health issues. How does this effect the way you feel about him/her?
body:
My depression seems to be incurable. Anti depressants helped for a bit but then made me worse, therapy helped a little, and exercising was just another thing for me to become obsessed with. I have good and bad days but even on a good day I can flip and start bashing my head against the wall or try to put a carrier bag over my head. 

I really don't feel like he loves me anymore. He shows me a bit but we both work long hours and don't see each other much and  he takes gaming quite seriously. We used to sometimes play together but that doesn't happen anymore. I tried to watch the walking dead with him but it upset me too much. I know it's ridiculous and I really enjoyed it when I watched it before but I'm not in the right place mentally for it anymore! My SO is very comfortable financially, VERY attractive (people often comment he looks like a male model) and working on a PhD. He could be with anyone. 

So I'm interested to know why men in particular stay with their partners even when the going gets tough.

title: How common is stress ED?
body: I've been under a ton of stress and the pinaccle of it happened on sunday... well for the past 4 days I haven't been able to get a hard on. It's starting to scare me. I went from jerkin it twice a day to no sex drive what so ever. I don't have anyone to ask about it and if I did I sure as shit wouldn't tell them about it. It's kinda scary going from high sex drive to none.

title: Ever feel OK being a loner, and then hit a bad spot and regret it?
body:
Haven't been feeling well as of late, my routine is pretty wrecked because of it, and I'm realizing I have very little of a support structure available for times like this.

I'll likely be back on my feet soon enough, groaning because I have to return a family phone call or the like, or going on dating sites hoping for sex and hookups, and completely neglecting to give myself anyone to lean on when I really need them. But right now it seems like the most foolish thing ever for me to have done. If I had been OK just being friends with that girl, then maybe I could call her now and tell her how shitty I feel and get some support, etc.

Any other guys find this happens to them?

title: How important is your girlfriend's job/career?
body:
I'm almost 23 (w), am studying a useless degree and have no idea what job I'll ever have in the future. have anxiety so I often picture the worst case scenarios such as never getting a job at all and ending up homeless. Now I have also never dated, (due to a variety of reasons rooted in self-esteem issues) even though I yearn for love. I am working on improving myself so I can finally be a person that feels ready to start dating, but now I can't help but think: "Even if I fix all my issues, still won't graduate until I'm 25/26 and I'll probably won't find a (good/ decent) job right away. How am I supposed to date a guy now and then tell him that 1. I don't know what to do with my life 2. I might be unemployed in the future or 3. I might not earn much in the future 

IN THIS ECONOMY 

when other people my age have finished their degrees, have great careers and are already getting married/having kids... 

Would you drop a potential romantic partner if they told you that or is it not that serious? 

I feel like I have to wait until I know for sure what I'm gonna do, to start dating 😔

title: Fellow men, what lead to your extreme isolation?
body:
at 33 I’m having an existential crisis with copious amounts of loneliness and I can’t skate off this crud. 
It digs deep to the bone like a surgeon’s scalpel.
 Burning bridges, people backstabbing and lack of male third places forced me into this dark corner in the last 3 years. I’m already seeking some professional help for the first time. Hopefully it flickers a switch or something.

title: Why do lots of women hate “straight white men”?
body:
I’ve noticed a lot of women will automatically dislike you if they know you’re a “straight white man” and they assume the worst in you. From my own experience, I’ve been belittled, shut down, and scrutinized by many women for simply opening my mouth about general topics and basic facts.

Something that stems from my innocent curiosity, I can’t understand why I receive backlash for voicing my opinions. 

Do these types of women have a reason for being racist, heterophobic, and sexist? It seems to be a widely accepted behaviour in society to invalidate someone’s opinion based on their skin colour, sexuality or gender. After years of this I’m starting to feel guilty about being a straight white male.

title: Was your father a person who always thought he knew best? How is life now, that you are an adult?
body:
In my case it is not only that he is a well known psychology professor, but that he inherited from his parents several pieces of real estate and a sum of cash I'm not going to disclose. My mother is very traditional and let him always lead because a) he is the man and b) he is a professor, so he knows best.

It backfired enormously during my college years: Overall I was a good high school student and I qualified to study law at a prestigious university (won't disclose either), but I only wasted my time. Failing my studies and wasting three years due to the sunk costs fallacy, I became isolated and refused human contact for the next 5 years. 8 years wasted.

He didn't do it wanting to hurt me. His intentions were good. I mean, I don't have any ground to think the opposite. Possibly he tried to make out of me a copy of himself: A successful university teacher, a proud member of the upper middle class. I'm not so sure about ever talking with him about this, because I don't know how he could interpret it. I could very easily start insulting him.

Thanks for reading the wall of text.

title: How would you feel if your date revealed they had a history of mental health problems that had screwed up a chunk of their life?
body:
I'm not in a position to date yet, so just pondering how this is going to affect things when I do look to find a SO?  If you're 'back on your feet again' working etc, how much does this part of my past affect things assuming there's a mutual physical attraction? Is it a deal breaker? 

FYI 35 yo female, uni and post-grad education, wide range of travel and hobbies before getting ill. Unable to work due to major depression past 4 years. Optimistic that current meds cocktail might actually be helping...




EDIT: I'd like to say a big thank you to you all for taking the time to give me such considered feedback. And for so many people responding, too. I now have to accept that it will put some/quite a few people off. I can't change that. It's their prerogative as much as my height or eye colour. Thanks for spelling it out for me. 

I'm not in a place to either seek out or date anyone at the moment as I need a lot of support to fill in for my lack of motivation/interest in most things. I wouldn't date me right now:) I should clarify that I have 'straight' depression largely caused by being very anxious, perfectionism and black and white thinking since childhood. I had a great psychologist work with me and, hopefully, I'm a much more mature person who can understand the nuances of other's behaviour and speech. It's opened up a whole new aspect of the world for me and it's fascinating. 

I'm not bipolar so I don't experience the manic/extreme behaviour. I'm more of the floppy 3-toed sloth variety of depressive.

title: Men, what was your "Oh sh*t I have a problem" moment?
body:
At university, I was out for dinner with about fifteen people from my course. It was a great evening and everyone was having a great time. We were at a restaurant by a river, with a bridge over a weir. It was winter and very cold outside. 

Partway through dinner, I stood up, said "excuse me", and went and stood on the bridge over the weir and stared at the water. I was absolutely convinced everyone inside hated my guts and the only way I could think to make the anxiety go away was to jump in. Even though, rationally speaking, I know those people liked me as a person. 

Anyway, after about twenty freezing minutes I got my phone out and called my mother and told her frankly where I was and what I was thinking about. To her credit, she was absolutely incredible - she told me quite calmly that that would be a pretty silly thing to do ("all that will happen is you'll get wet") and that I should go back inside, even though I'm pretty sure she would have been shitting herself. 

Eventually I decided she was right and I went back inside and everything was normal. Next day I signed up for counselling and now I'm in control. 

The thing that gets me about the episode is how irrational it was - how totally untrue my anxiety was, but how much control it had over me. It made me resolve to fight it hard and not be in that position again. 

So what's your oh shit moment?

title: How do you handle fear when its something about your health?
body:
I lose my health insurance next month because I'm turning 26. Im working overtime to find a job with health benefits and despite my having 3 degrees, im not having any luck. Im a chronic pain patient with a serious connective tissue disorder called Loeys-Dietz so im on a lot of meds that I need in order to survive Orland not be in crippling pain but I won't be able to get them after I lose my health insurance. 

Im scared out of my mind. Ive been having panic attacks for the last week. Despite everything I've been through, I've never been scared but now, im frequently breaking down and crying (thank God I live alone except for my dog) because im absolutely terrified about whats going to happen once I lose my health insurance.

I've tried everything I can think of but fear wins every time and im losing hope...

title: Went and got sober a few years ago, now I'm going to the gym trying to level up in life. Why am I facing all of my problems and issues all over again?
body:
Times are hard. I'm repeating the recovery process over again but a different situation. Every self doubt and insecurity is blowing up in my mind tremendously and I don't know what to do besides keep going hard 24/7 to drown out my thoughts.



Life is a blur right now.

title: Men, how did you master the art of I-don't-give-a-f#ckism?
body: Long story medium, I did so by spending 1 year after high school living in a log cabin near a remote beach with no internet or phone. The main purpose was to help me contemplate whether I should end it all. The longer I stayed there, the less things started to worry me, the more I started to realise that life is too short to dwell on shit that doesn't matter.

title: What makes you settle for bad looking girls?
body:
I just wouldn't mind knowing what would make you settle for an unattractive girl. I suppose some think they can't do better, or they're really desperate, or they think their personality makes up for it?

I look ok in clothes but sadly I disappoint guys when I take the clothes off to reveal scarred skin and very saggy flat ugly boobs. And a horrific face too that no amount of makeup can save.

I asked my current fuck buddy and he says he doesn't have to see my tits when I'm bent over, and that's his favourite position. Also, darkness. 

He's so good looking he could get a much prettier girl with beautiful skin and perky tits and whatnot, I guess he fucks me because I'm convenient, or something. I have no clue.

Anyway, to those of you who have slept with ugly girls, why did you do it?

title: Why is it that rejection hurts so much more from certain women
body:
There is customer on my route (I’m a mailman) that I’ve fancied for sometime now. I never actually worked up the courage to ask her out but I would be nice. Didn’t want to poop where I eat. But being nice didn’t work so I decided to pretend to be awfully uninterested. That got a door slammed in my face when I had a package that needed to be signed by her. After that I had to just force myself through the rest of the workday and take a mental health day.
Can’t wrap my head around why this hurts.

title: What age do you guys consider the cut-off for ‘figuring out your life’
body:
